CHINESE PLANTS DESCRIBED IN LOUREIRO'S FLORA COCHINCHINENSIS.

In what follows I shall give a list of all the plants Loureiro mentions for China and include also those species which he had gathered only in Cochinchina but which subsequently have been observed also in China.

I arrange the list according to the Natural System adopted by Bentham and Hooker, giving for each plant at first the Loureirian name, the habitat and the Chinese name as noticed by Loureiro, and quoting the page in the Flora cochin. After this I shall add, if necessary, my observations. Many of Loureiro's plants have by the progress of science received other names and mistakes made by that author have been occasionally corrected. In my researches with respect to Loureirian plants I depend upon De Candolle's Prodromus, Kunth's Enumeratio plantarum, Bentham and Hooker's Genera Plantarum, Bentham's Flora hongkongensis, the botanical papers published by Maximowics, Dr. Hance and others. I shall also give the Chinese names of plants noticed by Loureiro, as far as I have been able to ascertain them.

With respect to the abbreviations used in the following notes I beg to refer to my list of Chinese plants known to Linnaeus. When quoting Osbeck I always refer to that list not to Osbeck's Voyage.

DICOTYLEDONS.

1. Clematis minor. Lour. Canton. Sin: wei leng sien (威靈仙). 422.
   Cl. terniflora. D. C. Maxim. Dec. XX. Cl. terniflora. Fl. hok. 7. Cl. chinensis. Retz. (?) Ost. 1.
2. *Clematis sinensis*. Lour. China. Sin: *mu tan* (木通).

422. Willdenow thinks, that it is the same as *Cl. chinensis*. Retz. Obs. 1.

3. *Clematis virginiana*. Lour. (non Linn.) Cochin-China. 422.

*Clem. apiflora*. D. C.—Maxim. Dec. XX. Amoy, N. China (Fortune).

4. *Thalictrum sinense*. Lour. China. Sin: *poi mu* (貝母). 423.

D. O. I. 16. Planta dubia.

5. *Hecatonia pulustris*. Lour. Sin: *chu lien*. Canton. 371.

D. C. I. 84. *Ranunculus scleratus*. Linn.—Hoe. add. Fl. hgt. 96.

6. *Hecatonia pilosa*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *Khao tsao*. 371.

D. O. I. 48. *Ranunculus cantoniensis*. Not observed after Lour.

7. *Paeonia officinalis*. L. China borealis. Culta per tot. imp. Sinense. Sin: *wo yo* (芍藥). 419.

The above Chinese name is applied in China to *P. albiflora*. Pall.

8. *Calligonum asperum*. Lour. Cochin. 418.

D. C. I. 70. *Trachytales Calligonum*.—Delima serrantacea. Linn. Fl. hgt. 7. G. Fl. I. 12.—*Tetracera serrantacea*. Willd. Hoe. Add. Fl. hgt. 99.

9. *Actaea aspera*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *tsia ip* (鐵葉). 405.

D. C. I. 70. *Trachytales Actaea*.—G. Fl. I. 12. spec. valde dubia.—Bridgm. Chrest. 457 (8).

10. *Illicium anisatum*. L. Provinciae ad occasum Canton. Sin: *pa co huai kiam* (八角茴香). 432.

Comp. above Linn. Chin. pl. 2.

11. *Liriodendron Coco*. Lour. Macao, Canton, Cochin. culta. 424.

Hence Advers. in stirp. crit. 6. *Magnalia pumila*. Andr.—Fl. hgt. 8.

12. *Liriodendron lilifera*. Linn. Canton. Lour. 424.

D. O. I. 61. *Magnalia indica*. Not observed after Lour. Comp. also Trim. Journ. bot. IV. 235. *Liriodendron* in China.

13. *Liriodendron Figo*. Macao, Canton, cult. 424.

Hence Advers. 6. *Michelia* (*Magnalia Andr.*) fissa.

14. *Michelia Champaca*. Linn. Macao, Cooh. cult. Lour. 425.

15. *Uvaria uncata*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *yin chao* (蔴爪). 426.

The above Chin. name is applied in Canton to *Artabotrys odoratissima*. R. Br. (Parker.)—Fl. hgt. 10.

16. *Desmos chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *cau tsit fung*. 431.

D. C. I. 91. *Uvaria chinensis*. Species non satis nota.

17. *Anona squamosa*. Linn. China, Cooh. cult. Sin: *pu son* (木通). Lour. 427.

As is known this is a native of tropical America. The name Lour. gives as a Chinese appellation is the Malay name of the fruit, being *bawo* (Cyclop. of India.)
18. *Fibranrea tinctoria*, Lour. Sin: *tien sien tan* (天仙藤). China, Coch. 769.

G. Pl. I. 39. Plants imperfectly noted.

19. *Nymphaea Nelumbo*, Linn. Sin: *lien hoa* (蓮花). China, Coch. Lour. 416.

D. C. I. 118. *Nelumbium speciosum*, Willd.—Obs. 3—Fl. hbk. 15.

20. *Chelidonium majus*, Linn. China, Sin: *hoam lien* (黃連). Lour. 402.

Chel. majus is common in North-China. D. C. I. 123. means that Lour.'s plant is a new species: *Ch. sinense*.

21. *Lepidium petraeum*, Linn. China, Sin: *tin li* (葶藶). Lour. 479.

D. C. I. 226. *Nasturtium? chinense* (Lour.'s plant). Not observed in China after Lour.

22. *Cardamine Chelidonis*, Linn. Canton. Lour. 484.

D. C. I. 152. European plant, not observed in China, after Lour.

23. *Ricotia cantoniensis*, Lour. Canton. 482.

D. C. I. 157. Dubia.

24. *Brassica oleracea*, Linn. China, Coch. cult. Lour. 481.

25. *Brassica chinensis*, Linn. Sin: *chai lan ts'ai* (芥藍菜). Cult. China, Cochin. Lour. 482.

Obs. 5. The above Chin. name given by Lour. is found in the Kuang tung tung chi. (vegetables).

26. *Sinapis chinensis*, Linn. Sin: *kiai ts'ai* (芥菜). Cult. China, Coch. Lour. 485, means, that it is only a variety of *S. juncea*. L.

Linn. Chin. pl. 8. In Peking different varieties of *S. juncea*. L. go under the above Chinese name.

27. *Sinapis pekingensis*, Lour. Sin: *pe ts'ai* (白菜). Peking. cult. 485.

In Peking this Chin. name is applied to *Brassica chinensis*.

28. *Sinapis brassicata*, Linn. Sin: *pe kiai* (白芥). China, Coch. cult. Lour. 485.

Linn. Chin. pl. 10.—D. C. I. 219.

29. *Thlaspi bursa pastoris*, Linn. China. Lour. 480.

D. C. I. 177. *Capsella bursa past.* Moench.—Fl. hbk. 14. Frequent in N. China.

30. *Raphanus sativus*, Linn. Cult. China, Coch. Sin: *tsai fu keo* (菜菔根) or *la bao* (薔薔).—Lour. 481.

Flor. hbk. 17.—Cultivated throughout China.

31. *Cleome sosandra*, Linn. Cochin. Lour. 483.

D. C. I. 242. *Polanisia viscosa*—Fl. hbk. 18.
32. *Capparis cantoniensis*, Lour. Canton. Sin: *hiang lac phung*. 404.
D. C. I. 253. Spec. dubia.

33. *Capparis fulcata*. Lour. Canton. 405.
D. C. I. 248. Orataeva falata. Not observed after Lour.

34. *Roseda chinensis*. Lour. Sin: *thin ki hoam*. Canton. 367.
Not observed after Lour.

35. *Viola primulifolia*, Linn. Canton. Lour. 628.
D. C. I. 293. Viola Patrinii var. chinensis. (Lour.'s plant.) Fl. hongk. 20.

36. *Viola odorata*, Linn. Canton. Sin: *kiet tuong hoa*. Lour. 627.
Maxim. identifies Lour.'s plant with *V. serpens* Wall. Fl. hongk. 20.

37. *Phoberos chinensis*. Lour. China. Sin: *Cu tsu*. 389.
Flora hongk. 19. *Scopolia chinensis*. Clos.

38. *Salomonia cantoniensis*. Lour. Sin: *siao lam teng*. Canton. 18.
D. C. I. 384. Specimen in hb. Mus. Paris. Fl. hongk. 44.

39. *Polygala sibirica*, Linn. Canton. Lour. 517.
Frequent in North-China.

40. *Polygala glomerata*, Lour. Canton. Sin: *tai kam* (大金 Parker). 518.
D. C. I. 326. Specimen in Mus. Paris.—Fl. hongk. 44.

41. *Dianthus caryophyllus*, Linn. China, colitur. Lour. 345.
Probably another species.

42. *Dianthus chinensis*, Linn. China, Cooh. cult. Lour. 346.
Lin. Chin. pl. 14.

43. *Helonaa sinensis*, Lour. Canton. Sin: *yu mi*. 351.
According to Willdenow this is *Lychnis grandiflora* Jacq.—Bridgm. Chrest. 464 (66.) *Lychnis coronata*, Sin: 虹美入 *a mi yan*.

44. *Cerastium repens*, Linn. Canton, Cochin. Sin: *a kim tsao*. Lour. 349.
D. C. I. 419. *Cerastium arvense* L. P.—The latter plant occurs in North-China.

45. *Portulacca oleracea*, Linn. Sin: *ma chi kien* (馬齒莧) China, Coch. Lour. 359.
Fl. hongk. 327.

46. *Tamarix chinensis*, Lour. Provincia Canton. Sin: *chon nham lau* (觀音柳). 228.
Hook. et Arn. voy. Beech. 186. South-China. Frequent in N. China.

47. *Hypericum aureum*. Lour. Canton, spout. et cult. Sin: *gwei thoung hoo* 578. Lour. says: suspicio hoc esse *H. monogynum* Thbg.

Hook. et Arn. voy. Beech. 173. *H. chinense*. Mill. S. China.—Linn. Chin. pl. 15.—Sin: 金絲海果花 *kin ses hai fang hua* (Parker.)

48. *Hypericum olympicum*. Linn? Canton, Cochin. Sin: *hoang xoc*. Lour. 577.

49. *Hypericum petiolatum* Linn. Sin: *hoang nieu than* (黃牛頭). Canton. Lour. 577.

Linn.'s plant is a dubious species. D. C. I. 548. *Vismia*? petiolata. Brasilia.

50. *Cambogia Gutta*. Linn. Sin: *hoam lo* (黃檀?). Cochin. Siam, Cambodja. Lour. 406.

D. C. I. 581. *Garcinia Cambodja*. Desr.—According to Hanbury (Science pap. §29.) the Gamboge of Siam and Singapore is yielded by *Garcinia Morella*.

51. *Thea cantoniensis*. Lour. Sin: *Ho nam cha yong* (河南茶). Canton. 414.

D. C. I. 580. *Thea chinensis*, var. *Bohea*. L. In the Chinese name given by Lour. *Ho nam* means probably the island of this name on which a suburb of Canton is situated.

52. *Thea cochinchinensis*. Lour. Cochin. boreal. 413.

53. *Thea oleosa*. Lour. Sin: *yeu cha* (油茶). Canton 414.

Not observed after Lour.—Not to be confounded with *Thea oleifera*. Abel, which according to Hance is *Camellia Sasanqua*. Thb.

54. *Camellia drupifera*. Lour. Cochin. Oleum ex nucleis expressum aestimatur ab indigenis. 499.

D. C. I. 529. Dubia.

55. *Malva verticillata*. Linn. Canton, Coch. rara. Sin: *tung quei tsu* (冬菜子). 514.

Comp. Linn. Chin. pl. 20.

56. *Sida cordifolia*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 503.

Fl. hbk. 33.

57. *Sida scaparia*. Lour. Cochin. 504.

D. C. I. 460. *Sida asota*. Burm. Fl. hbk. 32.

58. *Urena polyflora*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *wie than fo*. 508.

D. C. I. 441. Malachra Urena. Dubia.

59. *Urena procumbens*. Linn. China, Coch. Lour. 507.

Oct. 24.

60. *Urena sinuata*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 507.

Flor. hbk. 34.
61. *Urena lobata*. Linn. China, Cooh. Sin: *sie than fo* (see 58). Lour. 507.
   Obs. 23.—Fl. hbk. 34.

62. *Hibiscus syriacus*. Linn. Cochin. In China non visus. Lour. 511.
   Journ. Bot. 1879. 9. Hance. Canton prov.—Frequently cultivated in China.

63. *Hibiscus mutabilis*. Linn. China. Coch. cult. Sin: *ju yung* (芙蓉). Lour. 511.
   Obs. 25.—Journ. Bot. 1879. 9. Hance. Canton prov.

64. *Hibiscus Rosa sinensis*. Linn. China. Cochin. cult. spont. Lour. 510.
   D. C. I. 448, gives only India as native country. I know that it is much cultivated in South-China.

65. *Hibiscus esculentus*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *hoang souc quai* (黄蜀葵). Lour. 512.
   D. C. I. 450. India orient. cult.

66. *Hibiscus tillacenus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 509.
   Fl. hbk. 35.

67. *Gossypium herbaceum*. Linn. Cult. China, Coch. Sin: *mien fu* (棉花). Lour. 505.
   Obs. 27.

68. *Bombax pentandrum*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *mo mien hoa* (木棉花), *uen zu*. Lour. 504.
   D. C. I. 479. Eriodendron africatum. India orientalis.—The tree is well known to the Chinese.

69. *Helicteres undulata*. Lour. Cochin. 649.
   Sprong. Syst. III. 81. *Sterculia lanceolata*. Cav.—Fl. hbk. 36.

70. *Helicteres angustifolia*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *san chi ma* (山芝麻). 647.
   Obs. 29.—Fl. hbk. 37.—Parker, the same Chin. name as Lour.

71. *Pentapetes phoenicea*. Linn. Cult. China, Cochin. Lour. 497.
   D. C. I. 498. India orient.—Cultivated Canton (Williams).

72. *Fallopia nervosa*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *hai pu ip* (藤蔓菜 Williams). 410.
   Hance, Journ. Bot. IX. 239. *Grewia micros*. Linn. known to Linn. from Ceylon.—Fl. hbk. 42.

73. *Ardisia rugosa*. Lour. Cochin. 409.
   G. Pl. I. 223. *Grewia regem*—Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 170

74. *Corchorus capsularis*. Linn. Canton, agrest. cult. Sin: *san lim ma*. 408.
   Fl. hbk. 40.
75. *Oxalis corniculata*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *tsao tsiao* (酸菜草). Lour. 350.

Obs. 82.—Fl. hgt. 66.

76. *Oxalis sensitiva*. Linn. Canton, Cochin. Sin: *chan tsou*. Lour. 350.

D. C. I. 690. *Bisphytum sensitivum*. Ind. orient.—Not observed in China after Lour.

77. *Averrhoa Carambola*. Linn. China austr. Cochin. Sin: *yam tao* (楊桃). Lour. 854.

Obs. 83.—Fl. hgt. 56.

78. *Impatiens Balsamina*. Linn. Cochin. agrest. cult. Lour. 626.

Obs. 84.—Much cultivated throughout China.

79. *Impatiens chinensis*. Linn. Canton, cult. spont. Sin: *kum than kio*. Lour. 625.

Obs. 85.

80. *Impatiens mutila*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 627.

81. *Impatiens cochleata*. Lour. Canton. cult. Sin: *tsien chi kum*. 686.

82. *Tribulus terrestris*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *cie li tsou* (黃藥子). Lour. 331.

Very common in North-China. Has been gathered also in Formosa.

83. *Euta chalepensis*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *sao tsao*. Lour. 330.

D. C. I. 710. *R. knautiana*. According to Parker, list of Canton plants, the Chinese call it 菊花 ch'ou ts'ao.

84. *Lepta triphylla*. Lour. Cochin. 104.

Flora hgt. 59. *Evedia Lamarckiana*. Bth.

85. *Fagara piperita*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 101.

Fl. hgt. 58. *Zanthoxylum nitidum*. D. C. I. 737.

86. *Piper pinnatum*. Lour. China. Sin: *wu tsiao* (胡椒). 38.

D. C. XVI. l. 389. ignotum.—Judging from the Chin. name it seems to be a *Zanthoxylum*.

87. *Zanthoxylum clava Herculis*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *so*. Lour. 810.

D. C. L 737. American species.

88. *Jambolifa pedunculata*. Linn. Macao. Lour. 283.

Benth. et Hook. G. Fl. I. 308. *Armeniaca Gymnema*.—*Cynanchum pedunculata*. D. C. I. 723.—Fl. hgt. 59.—Loureiro's *Jamb. resinosa* 286 is the same.

89. *Triphasia aurantiola*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 189, 572.

G. Fl. I. 308. Species chinensis. *Limea trifoliata*, Linn. Known to Linn. from India.
90. *Chalca* paniculata. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: cao li yong (九里香). Lour. 331.

D. C. I. 537. *Murraya* paniculata. Ind. orient.

91. *Chalca* japonensis. Lour. China, Cochin. 332.

D. C. I 537. *Murraya* exotica. L. India. Flor. hbk. 50. According to Parker the Chin. name given by Lour. for Ch. paniculata, is applied to Murraya exotica.

92. *Quinaria* lanceum. Lour. Canton, cult. Sin: xan pi chu (黄皮树). 334.

D. C. I. 536. *Codiae* panstata. Retz.—G. Pl. I. 804. *Clausena Whampi* Oliv.—Fl. hbk. 50.

93. *Limonia* monophylla. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: sao peng lac, lingua Cantonensi zac may lac. Lour. 333.

D. C. I. 535. *Atalantia* monophylla. India orient.—Loureiro's plant may be *Atalantia Hindii*. Oliv. or *A. barifolia*. Oliv.—Fl. hbk. 51. Osb. 40.

94. *Citrus* aurantium. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: can su (柑桔). Lour. 569.

Osb. 37. As far as I know the above Chin. name in Canton is rather applied to the Mandarin orange.

95. *Citrus* nobilis. Lour. Abundanter in Cochinchina, etiam in China, quamvis Cantone illam non viderim. Sin: tsem can. 569.

Kerr bot. reg. t. 211. Mandarin Orange. Introduced into Europe from China in 1805.

96. *Citrus* fusca. Lour. Cochin. rarius in China. Sin: chi keu (枳椇?). 571.

97. *Citrus* margarita. Lour. Canton. Sin: chu tsu. 570.

98. *Citrus* madurensis. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: kim kuai (金橘). 570.

In Peking the above Chinese name is applied to Bunge's *Citrus microcarpa*, which is I think the same as *Citrus japonica*. Thbg. fructu globoso. Hooker bot. mag. 6128 (1874) refers also Loureiro's C. margarita to this species.—See also Osb. 39.

99. *Citrus* Decumana. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: yew zu (柚桔). Una varietas kiam yuen (香橼). Lour. 571.

Osb. 41. Largely cultivated in South-China.

100. *Citrus* medica. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 568.

Cultivated also in Peking.

101. *Citrus* digitata son Chirocarpus. Varietas Citri medicae. Lour. 568.

This curious fruit with its lobes separating into fingerlike divisions is frequently seen in China. It is cultivated in Peking as well as the *Citrus medica Cedra*, of which it is a variety. Ten years ago I stated in my
paper: On the Study and Value of Chin. bot. Works, p. 12, that the Chinese fingered Citron is the Citrus Sarcodactylis or Sarcodactylis helicterides of Gaertner Fruct. III. 89. t. 185. But that was an error. The latter, which Gaertner had received from Guyana, is as Benth. et Hook. G. Pl. I. 306 correctly state, a variety of C. decumana.

102. *Citrus Limon*, varietas Citri medicae. Sin: *tsin pi zu* (青皮樹). Lour. 102.

Osb. 42. *Citrus medica*, var. acida.

103. *Gonos amarissimus*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *a tan tsao*. 809.

D. C. II. 88. *Brusa sumatrana*. Roxb.—Fl. hbk. 60.

104. *Pimela nigra*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *o lam* (烏欖). 495.

Osb. 45.—D. C. II. 80. *Canarium Pimela*. Koen.

105. *Pimela alba*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *pa lam* (白欖). 495.

D. C. II. 80. *Canarium album*. Rausch.—Osb. 44.—Dr. Hance, Chinese Olives. Journ. Bot. 1871.

106. *Melia Azedarach*. Linn. Cochin. Sin: *zen lien*. Lour. 329.

D. C. I. 631. Ceylon, Syria.—Parker, Canton, 漆樹 *shen lien*.

107. *Aglaia odorata*. Lour. Camunium sinense sen Teju lang. Rumph. Amb. VII. 28. China, Cochin, 216.

According to Parker in Canton 米仔蘭 *mi tsu' lam*.

108. *Euonymus chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *kam kua* 194.

D. C. II. 4. Spec. dubia.

109. *Salacia cochinchinensis*. Lour. Cochin. 642.

D. C. I. 571. S. chinensis, L. China. Idem ac S. cochin. ex adnotat. in herb. Banksiano.—Linn. Chin. pl. 46.

110. *Aubletia ramosissima*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *an pat posc*. 110.

D. C. II. 23. *Palmaria Aubletia*. Schult.—Lour. specim. in herb. mus. Paris.—Fl. hbk. 66.

111. *Rhamnus Jujuba*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *ta tsao* (大棗). Lour. 195.

D. C. II. 31. *Zizyphus Jujuba*. Lam.—Journ. Bot. 1879. 10. Hance, Canton.

112. *Rhamnus Zizyphus*. Linn. Cochin. Canton. Sin: *hum tsao* (紅棗). Lour. 196.

D. C. II. 19. *Zizyphus vulgaris*. Lam.—Maxim. Rhamnaceae, the same as Z. chinensis. Lam. Frequent in China. Journ. Bot. l. c. Hance. Canton.

113. *Rhamnus soporifer*. Lour. In provinciis boreal. Sinarum. Sin: *soan tsao* (酸棗). 196.
In North-China the above Chinese name is applied to *Zizyphus vulgaris* Lam.

114. *Rhamnus lineatus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *che lem*. Lour. 197.

Obs. 48.—Fl. hbk. 67. *Berchemia Loureiriana*. D. C. II. 23.

115. *Vitis vinifera*. Linn. China cult. rara Cochin. Sin: *pu tao* (葡萄). Lour. 192.

116. *Cissus umbellata*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *yong co loi*. 106.

Not observed after Lour.

117. *Cardiospermum Corindum*. Linn. Canton. Lour. 294.

D. C. I. 603. Brazilian plant.

118. *Sapindus abruptus*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *mu koan zu* (無患樹). 293.

According to Parker this Chinese name in Canton is applied to *Sep. mahrossi*. Gaert. (Japan).

119. *Dimocarpus Lichi*. Lour. Colit. abund. China austr. Cochin. Sept. Sin: *ly chi* (荔枝). 287.

Obs. 51.—Fl. hbk. 47. *Nephelium litchi*. Camb.

120. *Dimocarpus Longan*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *lum yen* (龍眼). 288.

Obs. 51.—Fl. hbk. 47. *Nephelium Longan*.

121. *Rhus javanicum*. Linn. In sylvis cantoniens. Sin: *ziong tsai*. Lour. 228.

Obs. 58.—D. C. II. 67. *Rhus semialata*. L. var. *Osteckii*.—Add. Fl. hbk. 101.

122. *Augia sinensis*. Lour. China, Cochin. Cambodia, Siam. Sin: *tei su* (漆樹). 411.

The Chinese Varnish tree.—G. Pl. I. 418. *Augia est genus omnino ignotum; ex descr. multis notis cum Rhoide quadrat.*

123. *Baryxylum rufum*. Lour. Montes Cochin. bor. Sin: *tie li mu* (鐵力木). 326.

G. Pl. I. 464. *Baryxylum*, genus dubium.

124. *Aloezyhum Agallochum*. Lour. Montes Cochin. Sin: *chin kiam* (沉香). 327.

G. Pl. I. 464. *Planta ignota*. Comp. *Aloe wood* Semedo. 8.

125. *Trifolium Melilotus indica*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *sam pa lim*. Lour. 541.

D. C. II. 187, 189. Linn.'s plant *Melilotus salcata*. Desf. and ex parte *M. peruviana*, Europe, North-Africa.

126. *Trifolium globosum*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *tein li quang*. Lour. 542.

D. C. II. 196. Syria, Arabia, Italia.
127. *Indigofera tinctoria*. Linn. China, Cochin. Spont. cult. Sin: *lan tsao* (藍草), *ta cim* (大青).
Osb. 58.—Fl. hbk. 77.

128. *Indigofera rotundifolia*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *o kam sin* 559.
D. C. II. 233. Species dubia.

129. *Indigofera coccinea*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *louc ham tsao* 559.
D. C. II. 233. Indig. *hedysaroides*. Lam. ? India orient.

130. *Robinia amara*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *klu sem* (苦參?) 556.
D. C. II. 262. Species dubia. In Japan the above Chinese name is applied to *Sophora angustifolia*. S. et Z.

131. *Glycyrrhiza echinata*. Linn. China borealis. Sin: *Fu chau can tsao* (府州甘草). Lour. 543.
D. C. II. 248. Tataria.

132. *Glycyrrhiza glabra*. Linn. China, in variis locis. Sin: *Fan chow can tsao* (汾州甘草). Lour. 543.
D. C. II. 247. Europa austr.—*Gl. glabra*, var. *glandulosa* has been observed in North-China and may yield a part of Chinese Liquorice root (*lan ts'ao*). According to Chinese books the best comes from the north-western provinces. *Fu chow* (see 131.) is an ancient name for Fu-ku-hien in N. Shensi, *Fan chow fu* is in Shansi.

133. *Diphaea cochinchinesis*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 554.
G. Pl. I. 515. Genus *Ormosia*. Benth.

134. *Arachis asiatica*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 522.
D. C. II. 474. *Arachis hypogaea*. L.—Osb. 62.

135. *Hedysarum diphyllum*. Linn. Canton. Lour. 548.
D. C. II. 316. *Zornia angustifolia*. Sin. India orient.—Fl. hbk. 80.

136. *Hedysarum triflorum*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *sie tho tsao*. Lour. 549.
D. C. II. 324. *Desmodium triflorum*. India, China.—Osb. 68.—Fl. hbk. 88.

137. *Hedysarum triquetrum*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 547.
D. C. II. 326. *Desmodium triquetrum*. Ind. orient.—Osb. 68.—Fl. hbk. 88.

138. *Hedysarum pulchellum*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *a pho sien* (阿婆錢 Parker.) Lour. 548.
Osb. 69.—Fl. hbk. 88. *Desmodium pulchellum*. Benth.

139. *Hedysarum gangeticum*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *tsung loung thu*. Lour. 547.
D. C. II. 337. *Desmodium gangeticum*. Ind. orient.—Osb. 64.

140. *Hedysarum elegans*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *kap chiong tsao* 549.
D. C. II. 339. *Dicorma elegans*.—Fl. hbk. 83. *Desmodium elegans*. Benth.
141. *Hedysarum lagopodioides*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *Trui fum tsao*. Lour. 549.
   Obs. 70.—D. C. II. 324. *Urania lagopoides*.

142. *Hedysarum reniforme* Linn. Canton. Sin: *lo im tsao*. Lour. 545.
   D. C. II. 324. *Lunaea reniformis*. De Cand. quotes only Lour. and his spec. in Mus. Paris.—The plant of Linn. is referred to *Desmodium reniforme* (II. 327.)

143. *Vicia Faba*. Linn. China cult. Cochin. rara. Sin: *sam teu* (薔豆). Lour. 540.
   Much cultivated also in N. China.

144. *Pisum sativum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. non frequens. Lour. 539.
   Largely cultivated in N. China.

145. *Abrus precatorius*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 520.
   Obs. 72.—Fl. hbk. 92.

146. *Dolichos Soja*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *hoam teu* (黃豆) Lour. 537.
   D. C. II. 396. *Soja hispida*. Moench.—G. Pl. I. 580. *Glycine Soja*.—Obs. 73.—Largely cultivated throughout China.

147. *Erythrina corallodendron*. Linn. China aust., Cochin. Sin: *tum ya xu* (冬葵樹). Lour. 519.
   D. C. II. 412. *Eryth. indica*. Lam.

148. *Phaseolus vulgaris*. Linn. Cochin. raro. Lour. 527.
   Cultivated in N. China.

149. *Phaseolus radiatus*. Linn. Colit. China, Cochin. Sin: *liu teu* (綠豆): Lour. 529.
   Obs. 74.—Cultivated throughout China.

150. *Phaseolus Mungo*. Linn. Colit. China, Cochin. Sin: *siao teu* (小豆), *tsiam teu* (田豆). Lour. 530.
   D. C. II. 395. India orient.—The second Chinese name Lour. gives is applied in Peking to *Dolichos sinensis*.

151. *Dolichos trilobus*. Linn. Cult. China, Cochin. Tabera esculenta. Sin: *ken co* (根果). Lour. 535.
   D. C. II. 402. Lour.'s plant (non Linn.) *Pachyrhizus trilobus*—See above Martini. 36.

152. *Dolichos tetragonolobus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 532.
   D. C. II. 403. *Psophocarpus tetragonolobus*. Ind. orient.

153. *Dolichos sinensis*. Linn. Cult. China, Cochin. Sin: *tau co, teu co* (豆角). Lour. 530.
   Obs. 75.—Largely cultiv. in China.

154. *Dolichos ensiformis*. Linn. China, Cochin. Colit. Sin: *tao teu* (刀豆). Lour. 531.
D. C. II. 404. Cassia sinensis. India orient.—Obs. 76.—Fl. hbk. 83.

155. *Dolichos Catjang*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 538.

var. 1. *he tou* (黑豆).

var. 2. *min tou* (绿豆).

var. 3. *siao hum tou* (小红豆).

D. C. II. India orient.—*Hei tou* in Peking is a black variety of *Glycine Soja*—*Min tou* in Canton (Parker) is *Cajanus indicus* Spr.

156. *Dolichos anguiculatus*. Thbg. China. In Lusitaniam translatus. Lour. 531.

D. C. II. 400. *Dolichos umbellatus*. Thbg. Japonia.

157. *Dolichos biflorus*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *san cu*. Lour. 537.

D. C. II. 398. India orient.

158. *Dolichos purpureus*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *tsu pien tou* (紫扁豆). Lour. 534.

D. C. II. 401. *Lablab vulgaris*. Savi. var. purpurea. India orient. Aegypt.—Cultivated throughout China.

159. *Dolichos albus*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *pe pien tou* (白扁豆). 534.

D. C. II. 402. *Lablab perennis*. The above Chinese name is applied in Peking to *Lablab vulgaris* var. albidiflora.

160. *Cyrtius Cajan*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *zan tou ke* (山豆根). Lour. 565.

D. C. II. 406. *Cajanus flavus*. India orient.—Fl. hbk. 89.

161. *Rhynchosia volubilis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *chiao tao* 562.

D. C. II. 386. Specim. Lour. in hb. Mus. Paris.—Fl. hbk. 90.

162. *Pterocarpus flavus*. Lour. In sylvis sinensibus. Sin: *hoam pe mo* (黄皮木). Imperfectly known to Lour. 525.

163. *Derris trifoliata*. Lour. Provincia Canton. Sin: *san liao tao*. 526.

D. C. II. 416. Specim. in hb. Mus. Paris.—Fl. hbk. 94. *Derris uliginosa*, var. Loureiri.

164. *Robinia mitis*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *khu sem* (苦参?). Lour. 555.

D. C. II. 416. *Pongamia chinensis*. (Lour.'s plant). Non satis nota.—Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 181. South-China.—*P. glabra* Vent (Rob. mitis L.) has been observed in Hongkong.—Fl. hbk. 94.

165. *Robinia flava*. Lour. China borealis. Sin: *hoam khin* (黄芪?) 556.

D. C. II. 268. Species dubia.—There is some reason for supposing that Lour. intended the above Chinese characters, confounding the second,
which is pronounced ki with k'in.—Huang ki in Peking is Sophora flavescens Ait.

166. *Mimosa corniculata*. Lour. Canton. Sin: hoai hoa (槐花). 800.

D. C. II. 430. Spec. dubia.—The above Chin. name is applied in Peking, and in China, botan. works to *Sophora japonica*. L. a common tree in China.—Fl. hbk. 96.—Lour.'s description of his Min. corniculata agrees with S. japonica, with the exception of the bipinnate leaves. But he repeatedly commits this error in taking a small branch for a common leafstalk. See further on 409, Campsis adrepens.

167. *Anagyrus foetida*. Linn. Canton. Sin: pa pai. Lour. 318.

G. Pl. I. 556. Lour.'s plant (not Linn.'s, which is a native of Europe) is referred by Benth. and Hooker to *Ormosia*.

168. *Caesalpinia Sappan*. Linn. Cochin. Sin: su fam mo (蘇方木). Lour. 320.

This tree is probably not found in China, but the Chinese know well the Sapan wood.

169. *Guilandina Bonducella*. Linn. Canton. Sin: nam sie lac. Lour. 325.

Fl. hbk. 96.

170. *Mimosa fera*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: tsao kie (皂荚). 801.

D. C. II. 429. is right in supposing, that this is a Gleditschia. The above Chinese name is applied to *Gleditschia chinensis* Lam. a common tree in Peking as well as in S. China.—Fl. hbk. 100.

171. *Poinciana pulcherrima*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 319.

D. C. II. 484. India orientalis.—Cultivated in Canton.

172. *Cassia Tora*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 322.

173. *Cassia obtusifolia*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: tsao kit lam (章決明). Lour. 323.

Fl. hbk. 98. C. obtusifolia is referred to C. Tora.

174. *Cassia procumbens*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 324.

Osb. 78.—D. C. II. 504. *Cassia pusilla* Lam. I. 651.-China, India.

175. *Cassia Sophera*. Linn. China austr.—Sin: ay isi tau, kise mim tsu. (決明子). Lour. 324.

Osb. 77.—D. C. II 492. India, China.—Peking, cultivated.

176. *Tamarindus indica*. Linn. Cult. Cochin. Lour. 488.

Osb. 79.

177. *Mimosa arborea*. Linn. Canton. Sin: yam mu (楊木?). Lour. 800.

Linn.'s plant is a native of America. Thunberg's M. arborea of Japan, quoted by Lour., is *Acacia Farnesiana* Willd. Frequent in N. China.

178. *Mimosa farnesiana*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 801.
179. *Prunus domestica*. Linn. In plerisque Sinarum provinciis. Sin: *muci xu* (梅樹). Lour. 388.

Largely cultivated in N. China, but more commonly termed 梅.

180. *Amygdalus persica*. Linn. China, cult. Sin: *tao ho gia* (桃核仁). Lour. 386.

Cultivated throughout China.

181. *Amygdalus pumila*. Linn. China. Sin: *dao hoa houng* (桃花紅). Lour 387.

Comp. Maximowicz, Fragm. fl. Asiae orient. 1879. p. 14.

182. *Amygdalus communis*. Linn. Habitat et colitur affatim in China. Sin: *him ho gin* (杏核仁) Lour. 386.

As my friend Dr. Hance wrote me some years ago, he has never heard of the Almond tree having been observed in China. The *A. communis* in Bange's enum. pl. Chin. bor. is *Persica Davidiana*. The Chinese name Lour. gives for the Almond is as far as I know only applied to the Apricot, the kernels of which are used in China like almonds in the West.

183. *Spiraea cantoniensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *tsi chouc hoa* (珍珠花). 394.

Flor. hgt. 106.

184. *Rubus parvifolius*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 398.

D. C. II. 584. Obs. 81.—Fl. hgt. 106.

185. *Fragaria vesca*. Linn. Habitat et colitur in China. Sin: *fu yuen tsu* (覆盆子). Lour 398.

Probably another species.—*Fragaria elatior*, Ehrh. has been observed by my friend Mr. W. Hancock in the mountains west of Peking. (Maxim. l. c. p. 17.)

186. *Potentilla fruticosa*. Linn. China borealis. Sin: *yam chi cho* (羊蹄菜). Lour. 399.

Frequent in N. China. But the Chinese name Lour. applies to the plant is wrong, being that for *Rhododendron*.

187. *Rosa centifolia*. Linn. China. Sin: *ta mui hoa* (大玫瑰花). Lour. 396.

Not observed in China after Lour.

188. *Rosa cinnamomea*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *mui hoa* (玫瑰花). Lour. 395.

Peking, cultivated.

189. *Rosa spinosissima*. Linn. Flos rubescens. Cochin-china. Lour. means, that this may be *Rosa sinica*. Linn. Lour. 395.

190. *Rosa indica*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *tsiam hoa* (蔷花). Lour. 396.
191. *Rosa nankinensis*. Lour. Nanking. Sin: *tsiao mui hoa*. 397.

According to Dr. Regel. Monogr. Rosar. 357. a variety of *Rosa semper florens* Act. (a native of China.)

192. *Rosa alba*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *kim ym* (金樱), Lour. 396.

193. *Pyrus Malus*. Linn. China borealis. Sin: *pim po* (梨果). Lour. 393.

Cultivated in N. China.

194. *Pyrus communis*. Linn. Canton. cult. Sin: *ly* (梨). Lour. 393.

The Pears cultivated in N. China are for the greater part varieties of *P. chinensis*. Lindley.

195. *Pyrus Cydonia*. Linn. Pomum ovatum. China borealis. Sin: *mu qua* (木瓜). Lour. 394.

Probably *Cydonia sinensis*. Thouin, cultivated in the northern provinces.

196. *Mespilus pyracantha*. Linn. China, agr. et cult. Sin: *tan kieou tsu* (棠棣子), *zan cha* (山楂). Lour. 392.

In Peking the above Chinese names are applied to *Crataegus pinatibida*. Bge., in Japan to *Crataegus cuneata*. Sieb. ex Zucc. and *Crataegus sanguinea*. Pall.

197. *Crataegus bibas*. Lour. Macao, Canton. Sin: *pi pa xu* (枇杷樹). 391.

Fl. hbk. 108. *Eriobotrya japonica*. Lindl.

198. *Crataegus rubra*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *u ly mu*. 391.

D. C. II. 630. *Raphiolepis rubra*. Lindl. Fl. hbk. 108. Bentham regards it as identical with *R. indica*.

199. *Opa metrodoros*. Lour. Cochin. 379.

Decaisne, Pomac. 138. identifies it with *Raphiolepis indica*. Lindl. Fl. hbk. 107.—But in the G. Pl. I. 719. it is combined with *Strygium* resp. *Eugenia*.

200. *Saxifraga chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *ho ngi tsao* (虎耳草). 345.

D. C. IV. 48. *Saxifraga sarmentosa*. L.—Linn. Chin. pl. 84. Maxim. Dec. XII. means that Lour.'s species is different.

201. *Primula mutabilis*. Lour. Canton, cult. Sin: *sau cao hoa* (繡球花). 127.

D. C. IV. 15. *Hydrangea Hortensia*. China, Japan cult.

202. *Dichroa febrifuga*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *cham chan*. 369.

Fl. hbk. 128.
203. *Cedrela rosmarinus*. Lour. North-Cochin. Macao. Sin: *ti phu pi*. 199.
D. C. IV. 6. Itsa. Spec. dubia.

204. *Cotyledon laciniata*. Linn. Cochin. 352.
D. C. III. 895. Kalanchoe laciniata. Java, Molucc. Probably the same as *K. ceratophylla*. Haw. Has been observed in the province of Yunnan. (Hook. fl. ind.)

205. *Crassula pinnata*. Linn. Cochin. China? Lour. 231.
Kalanchoe pinnata. Pers.—*Bryophyllum calycinum* Salisb. Fl. hbk. 127. Add. fl. hbk. 103.

206. *Sedum anacampseros*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *pa touc san* (八毒散). Lour. 353.
D. C. III. 403. European species.

207. *Sedum stellatum*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *cheu li* Lour. 353.
D. C. III. 404. European species.

208. *Drosera umbellata*. Lour. China. Sin: *ku tsim tsao* (穀精草). 232.
Lour. applies the same Chinese name to *Eriocaulon*. See 624.

209. *Drosera rotundifolia*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 232.
Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 167. *Drosera* Loudrri.—Fl. hbk. 180.

210. *Quisqualis indica*. Linn. Canton, Cochin. Sin: *zi kiun tsu* (使君子). Lour. 336.
Hance Journ. Bot. 1879. 10. Canton province, Hainan. The same as *Q. sinensis*. Lindl.

211. *Psidium pyriforum*. Linn. and *Ps. pomiferum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 378, 379.
Fl. hbk. *Psidium Guyava*. Linn.—Osb. 86.

212. *Psidium caninum*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *pa hoa*. 379.

213. *Myrtus canescens*. Lour. Cochin. 381.
D. C. III. 240. *Myrtus tomentosa*. Ait. Fl. hbk. 121.

214. *Eugenia malaccensis*. Linn. India, Malacca, Macao. Lour. 374.

215. *Caryophyllus aromaticus*. Linn. In sylvis Cochin. borealis. Sin: *zan tim kiam* (山丁香). Lour. 406.
D. C. III. 263. In Moluccas.

216. *Opa odorata*. Lour. Cochin. 377.
D. C. III. 261. *Syzygium odoratum*. Staunton. China.—G. Pl. I. 719.

217. *Osbeckia chinensis*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *kam yong lu* (金香爐). Lour. 281.
218. *Melastoma dodecandrum*, Lour. Canton, Cochin. Sin: *pe gie hong* (白日紅). 336.

219. *Blastus cochinchinensis*, Lour. Cochin. 643.
Fl. hbk. 116. Add. fl. hbk. 103. *Analeum parviflorum*. Bth. Observed also in Formosa.

220. *Lawsonia spinosa*, Linn. Cochin. cult. Lour. 281.
D. C. III. 91. *Lawsenia alba*, Lam.—Osb. 92.

221. *Lagerstroemia indica*, Linn. China, Cochin. spont. cult. Sin: *sat chu moi hoa* (山紫薇花). Lour. 415.
Linn. Chin. pl. 98.—Fl. hbk. 112.

222. *Punica granatum*, Linn. Habitat et colitur in China et Cochin. Sin: *han xe lieu* (番石榴). Lour. 383.
Osb. 94.

223. *Epilobium tetragonum*, Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *soy hoang teng*. Lour. 276.
D. C. III. 65. Lour.'s plant (non L.) *Jasminum tetragonum*, Spr.

224. *Cubospermum palustre*, Lour. Cochin. 337.
D. C. III. 54. *Jasminum repens*, Linn.—Osb. 96. Dr. Hanoe. Canton. Journ. Bot. 1860. p. 261.

225. *Gentra chinensis*, Lour. Canton. Sin: *san si tsao*. 276.

226. *Trapa chinensis*, Lour. Canton. Sin: *ki xi* (菱實), *long co* (菱角). 109.
D. C. III. 64. *Trapa bispinosa*, Linn. fl.—Osb. 96.—In Peking the above names are applied to *Tr. bispinosa*, Roxb.

227. *Astrantius cochinchinensis*, Lour. Cochin. 274.
Fl. hbk. 123. *Homalina sagittatum*, Benth.

228. *Passiflora coerulea*, Linn. Canton. spont. Sin: *si hoa*. Lour. 644.
Rosm. Peponiferae 184. Lour.'s plant (non Linn.) *P. Lowesiri*, Don. Meyen obs. bot. 337. *P. coerulea*, Macao, cult.

229. *Carica Papaya*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *man xiu co* (萬壽果). Lour. 772.
American plant cultivated throughout the tropics.

230. *Trichosanthes anguinea*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. esculenta. Lour. 722.
Linn. Chin. pl. 97.

231. *Cucurbita Lagenaria*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *ku qua* (瓠瓜), *ho lo* (壺盧). Lour. 728.
D. C. III. 269. *Lagenaria vulgaris*, Sav.—Osb. 96.
232. *Cucumis acutangulus.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 727.

D. C. III. 308. *Luffa acutangula.*—Lin. Chin. pl. 96.

233. *Momordica Luffa.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *su qua* (絲瓜). Lour. 724.

D. C. III. 308. *Luffa aegyptiaca.* (i.e. Linn.'s plant). Lour.'s plant according to Nandin (Onocurb. in Ann. sc. nat. XII, 1859, 119.) *Luffa cylindrica.* Roem.

234. *Momordica cylindrica.* Linn. Canton, cult. Sin: *soy qua* (絲瓜). Lour. 725.

According to Nandin, i.e. the same as the preceding.

235. *Momordica Charantia.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *kau qua* (苦瓜). Lour. 725.

Flora hbk. 125.

236. *Morusia cochinchinensis.* Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *mo pie su* (木蓮子). 733.

G. Pl. L 825. *Numeraria cochinchinensis.*

237. *Cucurbita Pepo.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *tse qua* (冬瓜). Lour. 728.

The above Chin. name is applied in Peking to *Benincasa hispida.* Lev.—Nandin l.c. 87 also identifies Lour.'s plant with *Benincasa.*

238. *Cucumis sativus.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *hoam qua* (黃瓜).

The Cucumber is much cultivated throughout China.

239. *Cucumis Melo.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *can qua* (甘瓜). Lour. 726.

Various varieties of Melons are cultivated in N. China, as well as in the South.

240. *Cucurbita Melopepo.* Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *can qua* (南瓜), *fan qua* (番瓜). Lour. 729.

Nandin l.c. 84. Lour.'s plant (non Linn.) *Cucurbita moschata.* Duch.

241. *Cucurbita Citrullina.*—Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *si qua* (西瓜). Lour. 730.

Obs. 101. The Water Melon is largely cultivated in all parts of China.

242. *Solanum heterophylla.* Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *kau lou* (枯樓), *tien hou fuen* (天花粉). 629.

D. C. III. *Bryonia heterophylla.*—G. Pl. L 820. *Cissus* Spec. dubia.

In Peking the above Chinese names are applied to *Trichosanthes palmata.* Roeh.

243. *Bryonia hastata.* Lour. Canton. Sin: *si toung qua.* 731.

Fl. hbk. 134. *Karivia umbellata.* Arn.—Add. Fl. hbk. 104. *Zehneria umbellata.* Thw.
244. *Meliothria indica*, Lour. Cochin. 43.
Hoe. Add. Fl. hbk. 104.

245. *Mollugo triphylla*, Lour. Canton. Sin: ha khim su. 79.
Osb. 108.—Fl. hbk. 23. *Mollugo stricta*, Linn.—Benth. combines also *M. pentaphylla*, Linn. with this plant.

246. *Trisanthus cochininchinensis*, Lour. China, Cochin. 219.
D. C. IV. 68. *Hydrostegia abbreviata*, Rich.

247. *Sium sisarum*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: suci kin (水 菖). Lour. 223.

This plant has never been observed in China. See above Linn. Chin. pl. 106.—The above Chinese name is applied in Japan to *Oenanthe stolonifera*, D. C.

248. *Sium graecum*, Linn. Cochinchina, China. ? Lour. 223.
Linn.'s plant as well as that of Lour. are dubious. Comp. D. C. IV. 159. *Ligusticum graecum* and 148 *Kuandianxia sicula*.

249. *Anethum foeniculum*, Linn. Abundant in China, colit. etiam in Cochin. Sin: hoei hiam (茴 香). Lour. 226.
D. C. IV. 142. *Foeniculum vulgare*, Gaertn. Europa.—Much cultivated in Peking.

250. *Athamanta chinensis*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. spont.
Sin: ae chon (蛇 床). Lour. 222.
Lin. Chin. pl. 108.—D. C. IV. 152. *Salvia* (Salvia) Monnier.

251. *Coriandrum sativum*, Linn. Colitur in China, raro in Cochin. Sin: xe hu yu. Lour. 225.
D. C. IV. 250 considers Loureiro's Coriander a dubious plant. But *C. sativum* is much cultivated in North-China as well as in the South.—Fl. hbk. 136.

252. *Daucus Carota*, Linn. Canton, indeque in Cochin. translata. Sin: ku lu pa (胡 蘿 蔬). Lour. 222.
Cultivated throughout China.

253. *Caucalis orientalis*, Linn. Canton. Lour. 221.
Hance aduers. 15. Teritis praetermissa. Canton.

254. *Aralia chinensis*, Linn. Cochinchina. Lour. 234.
Osb. 109.—Fl. hbk. 185.

255. *Aralia octophylla*, Lour. Cochin: Canton (varietas). 233.
D. C. IV. 258. Dubia.

256. *Panax fruticosum*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 806.
D. C. IV. 254. Java.

257. *Plectranthia chinensis*, Lour. Prov. Canton. 201.
D. C. IV. 252. *Panax Leucrians*. Perhaps the same as *Panax aculeatus* or *Acanthopanax aculeata*. Osb. 111.—Add. Fl. hbk. 104.
258. *Aralia palmata*. Lour. China. Sin: *u kia pi* (五加皮). 233.
D. C. IV. 264. *Hedera scandens*.

259. *Stylium chinense*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *pau tsao*. 273.
D. C. IV. 267. *Marlea begonifolia*. Brbg. Nepal. China.

260. *Sambucus nigra*. Linn. In montanis Sinensibus. Sin: *u chu yu* (吳茱萸). Lour. 226.
D. C. IV. 323. *Sambucus Loureriana*. Dubia.

261. *Phytuma bipinnata*. Lour. Suburb. Canton. Sin: *toha leang tsao*. 172.
D. C. IV. 323. *Sambucus ebuleides* (specim. Lour. in Mus. Par.)

262. *Lonicera Xylostemon*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *kim ngan hoa* (金銀花). Lour. 186.
D. C. IV. 334. *Lonicera Lourerii*. Dubia.—In Peking the above Chinese name is applied to *L. chinensis*. Wats.

D. C. IV. 333. *Lonicera confusa*. Fl. hbk. 144. *Lon. multiflora*. Champ.—Maxim. diagn. plant. nov. asiat. II. 57.

264. *Polycosus lanceolata*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *am san cung*. 94.
Gen. Pl. II. 29. Specim. in Mus. Britann. Genus dubium. D. C. IV. 394. Genus Rubiacearum.

265. *Cephalanthus montanus*. Lour. China. Sin: *san yong mai*. 84.
D. C. IV. 323. *Planta ignota*, certe non *Cephalanthus*.

266. *Cephalanthus occidentalis*. Linn.? China. Sin: *soy yong mai*. Lour. 83.
G. Pl. II. 29. *Planta dubia*—D. C. IV. 539. *Ceph. orientalis*. Roem. et Schult. (non Linn.).—Comp. Fl. hbk. 146. *Ceph. occidentalis* (sub *Adina*).

267. *Oldenlandia repens*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *ka kim tsao*. Lour. 98.
D. C. IV. 419. *Dentalla repens*. Forst.

268. *Oldenlandia paniculata*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 99. Fl. hbk. 152.

269. *Hedyotis herbacea*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 98.
Obs. 114.—Fl. hbk. 151, note.

270. *Musaenda chinensis*. Lour. Suburb. Canton. 189.
D. C. IV. 373. Dubia, a genere removenda.

271. *Oxyceros sinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *cai tsai loa*. 187.
Fl. hbk. 156. *Randia sinensis*. Roem. et Sch.
272. *Gardenia floridana*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *chy tsu* (栀子). Lour. 183.

Linn. Chin. pl. 117.—Fl. hbk. 158.

D. C. IV. 888. Dubia, a Gardenia videtur excludenda.

274. *Genipa flavescens*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *sat than cay*. 185.

D. C. IV. 486. Ixora stricta. Rbg.—Obs. 118.—Fl. hbk. 158.

276. *Pavetta arenosa*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *ta sa*. 92.

D. C. IV. 498. A genere forte ab ordine excludenda.

277. *Gentiana scandens*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *ki si than* (雞屎藤). 213.

D. C. IX. 119. *Fædera foetida*. Linn.—Fl. hbk. 163.

D. C. IV. 611. Pl. dubia.—In Chinese botan. works the above Chinese name is applied to various species of *Polygonatum*. See Chi wu ming shi fu k'ao VIII. tab. 18, 19, 20, 31.—In Peking Pol. sibiricum. Red. bears this name.

280. *Crucianella angustifolia*. Lour? China. Sin: *wei lin sien* (see above l, clematis). Lour. 100.

D. C. IV. 586. European spec.

D. C. IV. 661. Stirps dubia.—The above Chin. name is applied in Canton to *Eleocharis scaber*. Linn. (Parker.)

282. *Spilanthes tinctorius*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 590.

D. C. V. III. *Adenostemma tinctorium*. Cass.

283. *Ageratum ciliare*. Linn. Canton. Lour. 591.

D. C. V. 109. India orient. Spec. obscura.

284. *Solidago cantoniensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *kam siong hoa*. 612.

Comp. Obs. 123.

285. *Solidago decurrens*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *hoang kam siong*. 612.

D. C. V. 342. Spec. dubia.
286. *Pteronia tomentosa*. Lour. Canton. Sin: chu hao mu. 597.

D. C. VI. 44. *Hieracium cantoniensis*. (Lour. specim. in hb. Mus. Paris.)—Fl. hbk. 174. Botanica indica. Bth.—Osb. 134.

Osb. 134.—D. C. V. 303. *Asteraceae indica*. Bl.—Hoa. add. fl. hbk. 107. Variety of *Boltonia indica*.

289. *Aster chinensis*. Linn.—Lour. 615, mentions this plant (*Callistephus chinensis*, Nees.) but states that he has not seen it.—Osb. 125.

291. *Baccharis chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: san po lang. 604.

D. C. VII. 238. Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 196. South-China.

D. C. V. 446. *Eupatorium chinense*.—Osb. 236.—Fl. hbk. 177.

293. *Baccharis Salevia*. Lour. (Conyza balsamifera, Linn.) 608.

D. C. V. 447. *Eupatorium balsamiferum*.—Haasbury Science pap. 398. Peculiar Camphor from China.

294. *Baccharis Dioscorides*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. spont. Sin: laong fu su. Lour. 608.

D. C. V. 450. Pinches Dioscorides.—In Aegypto.

295. *Conyza hirsuta*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: ho mei tsao. Lour. 606.

D. C. V. 458. Pinches hirsuta. Less.—Osb. 137.

296. *Sphaeranthus cochininchinensis*. Lour. China, Cochin. 623.

297. *Gnaphalium indicum*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 608.

Flor. hbk. 186.

298. *Buphthalmum oleraceum*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 618.

299. *Xanthium strumarium*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 689.

Linn. Chin. pl. 132.—Fl. hbk. 181.

300. *Siegenbeckia orientalis*. Linn. Cochinchina, China, sed Lour. ibi non obvia. 616.

Osb. 138.—Fl. hbk. 183.

Osb. Ct. 184.—Fl. hgt. 181. Bentham combines both of them with Helipta alba. Hassk.

D. C. V. 589. Wedelia calendulacea. Less.—Osb. 185—Fl. hgt. 182.

304. *Helianthus giganteus*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: hoam quei hoa (黃葵花). Lour. 623.

D. C. V. 591. Helianthus cochinensis? Pers.

305. *Verbesina spicata*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: thien oai teoi. 620.

D. C. V. 618. Dubia.

306. *Coreopsis biternata*. Lour. Canton. 605.

307. *Bidens bipinnata*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 596. Fl. hgt. 183.

308. *Bidens pilosa*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 596. Fl. hgt. 183.

309. *Coreopsis leucorhiza*. Lour. Canton. Sin: fan fum (白頭翁). 622.

D. C. V. 605. Bidens leucorhiza?

311. *Cotula anthemoides*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 602. Fl. hgt. 186.

Osb. 186.—Fl. hgt. 184.—Maximow. Dec. X. 516. Pyrethrum (Chrysanthemum) indicum Cass.var. & genuinum. (the wild growing form.)

Osb. 187.—Maxim. l. c. 518. Pyrethrum sinense. Sab. var. plenum.

314. *Centipeda orbicularis*. Lour. Cochin. 602.

Linn. Chin. pl. 183.—Fl. hgt. 186.

315. *Artemisia chinensis*. Linn. Canton. Ex foliis fit Moza. Sin: khi ngai (蒿艾). Lour. 600.

Linn. Chin. pl. 189.—Maxim. Dec. XL Tanacetum chinense. A. Gray.

316. *Artemisia vulgaris*. Linn. China, Cochin. spont. cult. Sin: ngai ye (艾葉). Lour. 600.

Osb. 140.—Fl. hgt. 187.

317. *Artemisia annua*. Linn. Peking. Sin: tao cao (薄荷). Lour. 599.

Fl. hgt. 187.—Common in North-China. 香蒿 hong hao.

D. C. VI. 106. Stirps Lour. certe diversa.

319. *Artemisia aquatica*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *hai tum*. Lour. 598.

D. C. VI. 126. An vera Artemisiae spec? *Eupatorium fomi culacrum* Bess?

320. *Artemisia judaica*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *ngaoc fu yong*. Lour. 597.

D. C. VI. 106. Stirps Lour. videtur diversa.

D. C. VI. 301. *Gynura pinnatifida*.—Cultivated in Peking.

D. C. VI. 301. *Gynura divaricata*.—Osb. 143.

D. C. VI. 301. *Gynura bulbosa*. Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 194. Fl. hbk. 186. identifies the latter plant with *G. pseudochina*, D. C.

326. *Cacalia sonchifolia* Linn. Cochin. Lour. 593.

D. C. VI. 302. *Emilia sonchifolia*.—Linn. Chin. pl. 144. Fl. hbk. 189. *Senecio sonchifolius* Moench.

D. C. VI. 501. *Gorteria*? Lourdei. Dubia.

D. C. VI. 529. Stirps dubia.

D. C. VI. 671. Dubia.

Largely cultivated in China.

D. C. VII. 40. Linn.'s plant is *Anandria Bellidiastrum*, var. *autumnale*. (Gerbera. G. Pl. II. 498.)

D. C. VII. 84. Europa, India.

The common Lettuce is cultivated throughout China.

D. C. VII. 240. *Malgedium floridum*. American spec.—G. Pl. II. 535. *Lactuca floride*.—According to Parker *Lactuca brevirostris* in Canton is *牛頭菜* *nieh li soi*.

341. *Sonchus sibiricus*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *zan ts* (山茶). Lour. 586.

D. C. VII. 219. *Malgedium sibiricum*. Linn. (*Lactuca sibirica*. G. Pl.). Siberia.

342. *Lobelia chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *puen fuen lien*. 628. Fl. hkg. 197. *Lobelia trigona*. Roxbg. var. *glabra*. Osh. 145.

Fl. hkg. 200.
344. *Hinkianthus biflora*. Lour. Canton. Sin: san lieo hoa. Lour. 840.

345. *Thela alba*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: pa hoa tan (白花藤). 147.

346. *Thela coccinea*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: che hoa tan (赤花藤). 147.

D. C. XII. 693. *Plumbago cocinea*. Boiss. Observed in Macao by Vachell.

Not to be confounded with *Pr. sinensis*. Lindl. D. C. VIII. 85. P. Sinensis Lindl. has lately been observed by Watters in the province of Hopeh. (Journ. Bot. 1880. p. 262).

348. *Sideroxylon cantoniense*. Lour. In suburb. Canton. Sin: san cot (山欖). 151.

D. C. VIII. 219. Species dubia.

350. *Ebenocylum verum*. Lour. Cochin. Sin: o mouc (烏木), u wuen mu (烏楠木). 752.

Osb. 146. D. C. VIII. 242. *Maba Ebenea*. Spreng.

351. *Diospyros Kaki*, Linn. fil. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: su su (柿樹). Lour. 278.

Cultivated throughout China.

352. *Myrtus chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: tan quai xiong. 382.

D. C. III. 242. Specim. Lour. in hb. Mus. Paris. Symplectos sinica Ker? China.

353. *Nyctanthes grandiflora*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: ta mo li (大茉莉). Lour. 26.

D. C. VIII. 302. *Jasminum Sambac*, var. triflataxum or 303. *Jasmi. arborescens*. Roxbg. (Lour.'s plant, non Linn.). But according to Parker *Jasminum grandiflorum* is also cultivated in Canton.

354. *Nyctanthes Sambac*. Linn. In hortis Chinas et Cochin. Sin: ao li hoa (茉莉花). Lour 25.

D. C. VIII 301. *Jasminum Sambac*. Ait.—Much cultivated in China.

355. *Jasminum officinale*. Linn. Canton. Sin: su han hoa (素馨花). Lour. 24.

Cultivated in South-China.—Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 197.

356. *Osmanthus fragrans*. Lour. In hortis Chinas, Cochin. Sin: mo si hoa (木犀花), guai hoa (桂花). Lour. 35.

*Gloa fragrans*. Thbg. Japan.—Osb. 149.—Cultivated throughout China, and also wild.
357. *Ligustrum sinense*. Lour. Canton. 23.
Fl. hbk. 215.—Decaisne Monogr. Ligustr. 86.—Introduced into Europe by Fortune. Gardener's Chron. 1878. 364.

358. *Vinca rosea*. Linn. China, Cochin. agrest. cult. Lour. 146.
Fl. hbk. 230.

359. *Plumeria obtusa*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 144.
D. C. VIII. 392. Lour.'s plant (non Linn.) *Plumeria acutifolia*. Poir. Southern Asia.

Hook. et Arn. bot. Beech. 199. Lour.'s plant is *Nerium odoratum*. Linn.—Comp. Linn. Chin. pl. 160.

361. *Pergularia divaricata*. Lour. China. Sin: hu muon. 210.
D. C. VIII. 418. *Strophanthus diversipes*. Grah.—Fl. hbk. 220.

362. *Apocynum alterniflorum*. Lour. Prope Cantonem. Sin: fu muon than. 209.
D. C. VIII. 440. Stirps dubia.

364. *Cynanchum inodorum*. Lour. Sin: ti yong than. 207.
D. C. VIII. 551. *Gymnema inodorum*.

365. *Cynanchum odoratissimum*. Lour. Canton. Cochin. cult. 206.
D. C. VIII. 618. *Pergularia odoratissima*. L.—Cultivated throughout China.

366. *Pergularia sinensis*. Lour. China. Sin: jì si than. 211.
Spreng. Syst. I. 836. *Periploca sinensis*.

367. *Stapelia chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: yong sau khau (王绣球). 205.
D. C. VIII. 636. *Koya carnosa*. R. Br.—Fl. hbk. 228.—Bridgm. Chrest. 454, 46.—Comp. also Maxim. Diagn. pl. nov. assist. I. 833. *H. chinensis*. Traill.

368. *Buddleia asiatica*. Lour. Cochin. 90.
Fl. hbk. 231.

369. *Gentiana aquatica*. Linn. Canton. Sin: ai kwee aiiong. Lour. 214.
D. C. IX. 108. Lour.'s plant is a new sp. *Gentiana Loureiri*. Giseel.

370. *Hydroclea inermis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: aiiong fung. 214.

D. C. IX. 500. Cordia Lourieri. Roem. et Sch. Non satis nota.

372. *Heliotropium indicum*. Linn. Cochin. cult. Lour. 126.

374. *Echium vulgare*. Linn. Lour. 125.

D. C. X. 18. Europa.

375. *Argyreia arborea*. Lour. China, Cochin. spont. cult. Sin: *truong quen hoa*. 167.

D. C. IX. 386. India orient. America.—Osb. 154.—Much cultivated in China, Bridgm. Chrest. 454. 52.

Osb. 155.—D. C. IX. 349. Ipomoea pes caprae. Sw.—Fl. hbk. 238.

380. *Convolvulus reptans*. Linn. China, Cochin. locis aquosis. Lour. 133.

Cultivated in Peking.

387. *Solanum nigrum*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 160.
Fl. hbk. 242.—Frequent in North-China.

388. *Solanum biflorum*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *thien phao* (天泡). 159.
Osb. 168.—Fl. hbk. 243.—Add. Fl. hbk. 242.

389. *Solanum indicum*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 162.
Osb. 162.—Fl. hbk. 242.

391. *Physalis Alkekengi*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *soan tsiam* (酸菜). Lour. 164.

392. *Physalis angulata*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 164.
Fl. hbk. 244.

Much cultivated in China.

398. *Nicotiana fruticosa*. Linn. China. Cochin. Sin: *yen ye* (煙葉). Lour. 136.
Osb. 168.

D. C. XVI. l. 206. 207. *Boehmeria nivea*. Hook. et Arn. Obs. 252. Fl. hkg. 381.—Sin: (蕁麻) *ch'u ma*.

537. *Parietaria cochinchinensis*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *mao soi cot* (霧水葛). 804.

D. C. l. c. 220. *Pouzolzia indica*. Gaudich. var. *alienata*, Wedell.

538. *Juglans regia*. Linn. China borealis. Sin: *ho tao* (核桃). Lour. 702.

Much cultivated in North-China.

539. *Morella rubra*. Lour. China, cult. Cochin. agrest. Sin: *yam mui* (楊梅). 670.

G. Pl. III. 401. *Myrica sapida*. Wall species in India orient. Chinaque frequens sylvestris vel culta.—Fl. hkg. 322. *Myrica rubra*. Sieb. et Zucc. Very near to *M. sapida*.
540. *Quercus cornea*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: chs (茶). 700.

Flor. hbk. 323.

541. *Fagus Castanea*. Linn. Cochin. sylvestris, China colit. Sin: liu tsu (栗子). Lour. 699.

D. C. XVI. 2. 116. *Castanopsis chinensis*. Spreng.—*Castanopsis chinensis*. Hance. Journ. Linn. Soc. X. 199. He gathered this species in the Canton province.—According to D.C. XVI. 2. 116. Loureiro's *Fagus cochinchinensis* belongs to the same species.

542. *Salix babylonica*. Linn. Frequens China, colit. Cochin. Sin: liu zu (柳樹). Lour. 747.

A common tree in North-China.

543. *Juniperus barbadensis*. Linn. China. Lour. 781 and *J. chinensis*. Linn. ibid.

D. C. XVI. 2. 488. Both of these Loureirian plants are referred to *J. chinensis*. L.—D. C. quotes Hance ins. Hongkong (not found in Add. fl. hbk.).

544. *Thuja orientalis*. Linn. China, Cochin. raro colit. Lour. 712.

Osb. 283.—Cultivated throughout China. *Biota orientalis*. Endl.

545. *Cupressus sempervirens*. Linn. China spont. Cochin. cult. Sin: pe zu (柏樹). Lour. 711.

D. C. l. c. 488. Not quoted for China. In Peking the above Chin. name is applied to *Biota orientalis*.

546. *Cupressus thyoides*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 711.

D. C. l. c. 484. *Chamaecyparis sphaeroides*. Spach. American plant.

547. *Pinus Abies*. Linn. China australis. Sin: xan mo (杉木). Lour. 710.

D. C. l. c. 482. *Cunninghamia sinensis*. R. Br.—Osb 235.—Fl. hbk. 387.

548. *Pinus sylvestris*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: sum (松). Lour. 709.

D. C. l. c. 389. *Pinus Massoniana*, Lamb. *P. sinensis*. Lamb. Fl. hbk. 337.—Add fl. hbk. 126. A common tree in all parts of China.

549. *Cycas inermis*. Lour. China, Cochin. spont. cult. 776.

D. C. l. c. 526. Culta in hort. Amstelod.

**MONOCOTYLEDONS.**

550. *Musa seminifera*. Lour. Cochin. cult. spont. Lour. 791.

*Musa odorata*. Lour. Cochin. cult. Lour. 791.

*Musa nana*. Lour. Cochin. 791.

*Musa corniculata*. Lour. Cochin. 791.

Desvaux in Journ. d. Bot. 1814 considers all these species only varieties of *Musa sapientum*. L.—Fl. hbk. 343.—Oab. 287.
551. *Musa saroscopos*. Lour. Cochin. 792.
Bot. Mag. tab. 1669. (1818). *Musa cocinea*. Andr. introduced into Europe, from China, in 1792.

552. *Canna indica*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *san kiam* (山薑). Lour. 13.
Obs. 249.—Fl. hbk. 249.

553. *Phyllodes placentaria*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *toung yop* (冬薑). 17.
Rosm. et Schult. Syst. I 18. *Phrysinia capitata*. Willd. (Malabar, China).

554. *Amomum Galanga*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. et agrest. Sin: *cao leam kiam* (高良薑). Lour. 7.
*Mentha Galanga*. Linn. *Galanga major*. Rumph.—Linn. Chin pl. 240.—Fl. hbk. 248. *Alpinia Galanga*. Sw.

555. *Amomum medium*. Lour. Provincia Yunnan imp. Sinensis. Sin: *tsao quo* (草果). 5.
Hanbury Science pap. 106. Chinese ovoid Cardamom. Known only from its fruits it seems.

556. *Amomum globosum*. Lour. In montibus Chinas et Cochin. Sin: *tsao keu* (草豆蔻). 6.
Hanbury, Science pap. 96. Large round Chia. Cardamom. The plant is unknown to modern botanists.

557. *Kaempferia Galanga*. Linn. In hortis Chinas et Cochin. Sin: *san lay* (三辣). Lour. 15.
Rosm. et Sch. Syst I. 27. India orient.

558. *Curcuma rotunda*. Linn. China, Cochin. frequens. Sin: *yum ngo men* (薑黃). Lour. 11.
Sprang. Syst. I. 10. *Kaempferia pandurata*. Roxbg. Sumatra.

559. *Curcuma longa*. Linn. Cochin. culta, inculta. Sin: *kiam koon* (薑黃). Lour. 11.
Fitchiger and Hanbury, Pharmacographia. 677: One sort of the Turmeric of commerce is China Turmeric.

560. *Curcuma pallida*. Lour. Cochin. Canton. Sin: *san kiam koon* (山薑黃). 12.

561. *Amomum Zingiber*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *san kiam* (生薑). Lour. 2.
Sprang. Syst. I. 12. *Zingiber officinale*. Rosc. India.—Without any doubt a native of China.

562. *Aristothele spiralis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *hoan lem*. 638.
Sprang. Syst. III. 708. *Spirenthes amoena*. M. B., which according to Ledebour Fl. ros. IV. 184. is *Spirenthes australis*. Lindl.—Fl. hbk. 360.

563. *Orobas Susannae*. Linn. Canton. Sin: *ma chac las*, Lour. 638.
*Nahumia Susanna*. R. Br.—Fl. hbk. 363.
564. *Arides odorata*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *fan lan* (鳳蘭). 642.

According to Loudon introduced into Europe in 1800.

565. *Epidendron ensifolium*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *lan hua* (蘭花). Lour. 640.

Osb. 243.—Fl. hbk. 357. *Cymbidium ensifolium*. Sw.

566. *Phajus grandifolius*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. 647.

Fl. hbk. 357.—*Bletia Tenevillas Br.*

567. *Epidendron tuberosum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 639.

Lamarck Enc. Bot. I. 186. West-Indies.

568. *Ceraja simplicissima*. Lour. China, Cochin. 633.

Endl. Gen. Pl. 1369. *Dendrobium*. Sw.

569. *Gladiolus undulatus*. Linn. Canton, in hortis. Lour. 45.

Spreng. Syst. I. 152. *G. cespitatus*. Linn. C. B. Sp.

570. *Ixia chinensis*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *se can* (射干). Lour. 46.

Lin. Chin. pl. 243.—Fl. hbk. 365. *Fardanthus chinensis*. Ker.

571. *Crinum seylanicum*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *sam taot*. Lour. 245.

Kth. enum. V. 581. *Crinum Loureiri*, Roem. et Sch.—Loureiro's *Crinum asiaticum*. Linn. (Lour. 244) is according to Roem. et Sch. a new spec: *Crinum cochinchinense*. But *Cr. asiaticum* Linn. has been observed also in South-China. Flor. hbk. 366.

572. *Amaryllis sarmatensis*. Linn. Culta in Sinis. Sin: *hien tsao* (薑草). Lour. 247.

Kth. enum. V. 618 *Herina?* *cochinchinensis*. Roem. The above Chin. name is generally applied to *Hemerocallis*.

573. *Taccia pinnatifida*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 368.

Kth. enum. V. 459. India orient., Philipp.

574. *Dioscorea oppositifolia*. Linn. China, Cochin. spont. edulis. Sin: *san yo* (山藥). Lour. 766.

Fl. hbk. 367.

575. *Dioscorea alata*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *yu thou* (芋頭). Lour. 765.

Osb. 245.—Kth. enum. V. 387. India orient, Philipp. The above Chin. name is rather applied to *Arum* or *Colocasia*.

576. *Bromelia Ananas*. Linn. Colitur in Cochin. Lour. 237.

577. *Stemona tuberosa*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *pe pe tsao* (百節草). 490.
578. *Smilax China*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *tsu fu lin* (土茯苓). Lour. 763.

Obs. 247. But Maxim. Dec. X. 410 doubts whether Lour.'s plant is really Sm. China.

579. *Smilax perfoliata*. Lour. Cochin. 763.

Kth. enum. V. 250. Also in Java (Blume.).—Journ. Bot. 1879. 15. Hainan (Swinhoe.).

580. *Dracaena ferrea*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. agrest. Sin: *tiet tsao* (铁草). Lour. 242.

Obs. 249.—Kth. enum. V. 24. Cordyline Jaquini. China. Introduced in Bengaliam.

581. *Hemerocallis fulva*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *kim cham hoa* (金针花). Lour. 254.

Linn. Chin. pl. 251.

582. *Allium Copa*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *tsun si* (葱). Lour. 249.

Under the above Chin. name in N. China *Allium fistulosum* is cultivated.

583. *Allium sativum*. Linn. Cult. China, Cochin. Sin: *suon* (蒜). Lour. 249.

Cultivated throughout China.

584. *Allium odoratum*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *kien* (薑), *khio*. Lour. 251.

Kth. enum. IV. 454. Lour.'s plant (non Linn.) is *Allium Thunbergii*. Don. Regel Monogr. Allior. 235 combines also *A. chinense*. Don. with this.—In Peking *A. odorum*. Linn. is known under the above Chin. name.

585. *Allium triquetrum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *kiai*, *kiao thos*. Lour. 250.

Regel l. c. combines it with *Allium Thunbergii*.

586. *Allium angulosum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *kieu tsai* (薑菜). Lour. 251.

Kth. enum. IV. 432. Lour.'s plant is *Allium alligatum*. Don. Baker refers this to *A. tuberosum* Roxb. Japan, China, India.

587. *Ornithogalum sinense*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *tien suon* (天蒜). Lour. 255.

Kth. enum. IV. 337. *Bernardia sikkimensis*. Lindl.—Fl. hok. 373.—Frequent in North-China.

588. *Aloe perfoliata* Linn. Regnum Champava. Sin: *lu hoi* (露骨). Lour. 252.

This Chin. name is applied in Canton to *Aloe vulgaris* Lam. (Parker) which is the same as the plant Lour. describes (non Linn.). India, Cambodia.
589. *Fritillaria cantoniensis*. Lour. Canton. Lour. 255. Kth. enum. IV. 255. Valde dubia.

590. *Lilium candidum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: pe ho (百合). Lour. 256. Kth. IV. 267. Dubia. The above Chinese name is applied to several Lilies with edible bulbs. In Peking *Lilium tigrinum*. Ker.

591. *Lilium pomponium*. Linn. Canton. Sin: ouon tan hoa (番丹花). Lour. 257. Kth. enum. IV. 259. Lour.'s plant is *Lilium tigrinum*. Ker.—Much cultivated in North-China.

592. *Lilium camtchatkense*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: chu tan hoa. Lour. 257.

593. *Melanthium cochinchinense*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: tien muen tum (天門冬). Lour. 268. Fl. hbk. 371. *Asparagus luddeus*. Lindl.—In Peking this plant is cultivated under the above Chin. name.

594. *Liriope spicata*. Lour. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: mac lau. 248. Fl. hbk. 371. *Ophiopogon spicatus*. Ker.

595. *Garciana cochinchinensis*. Lour. Cochin. Canton. Sin: tien tum. 20. Kth. enum. III. 380. *Philydrum lasanginosum*. Banks. Also in New Holland.—Fl. hbk. 380.—Sin: 田蔥 tien ts'ung. (Parker).

596. *Commelina communis*. Linn. Cochin. Lour 48. Obs. 252.—Fl. hbk. 376.

597. *Commelina benghalensis*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 49. Fl. hbk. 376.

598. *Tradescantia vaga*. Lour. Canton. Sin: xit koat houng. 239. Kth. enum. IV. 104. *Commelina vaga*.

599. *Lechea chinensis*. Lour. Canton. Sin: chat yu tsao. 76. Kth. enum. IV. 60. Commelina? Lourciri.

600. *Commelina tuberosa*. Linn. Cochin. Tubera edulia. Lour. 50. Journ. Bot. VI. 260. Lour.'s plant is *Anilema Lourciri*. Hance. Canton.

601. *Commelina medica*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: me muen tum (麥門冬). Lour. 50. Kth. enum. IV. 67. *Anilema medica*. R. Br.—The above Chinese name in China as well as in Japan is applied to *Ophiopogon japonicus*. Ker.

602. *Floscopia scandens*. Lour. Cochin. 238. Fl. hbk. 377. Probably identical with *Floscopia paniculata*. Hassk. Indian Archip. Hongkong.
603. *Scirpus capsularis*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *tem sie tsao* (田心草). 55.

*Journ. Bot.* 1875. 106. Dr. Hance has proved, that this is *Juncus effusus* Linn. common in China, Manchuria.

604. *Cocos nucifera*. Linn. Cochin. Hainan. Sin: *yai su* (椰樹). Lour. 692.

605. *Areca catechu*. Linn. Cochin. China austr. rario. Sin: *pin lam* (檳榔). Lour. 695.

606. *Phoenix pusilla*. Lour. Cochin. 753.

Add. Fl. hbk. 129. Most likely identical with *Phoenix javanica*. Roxb. Ph. aculeata. Bth. Fl. hbk. 340.

607. *Pandanus odoratissimus*. Linn. China, Cochin. spont. cult. Lour. 739.

Add. Fl. hbk. 129.

608. *Acorus Calamus*. Linn. Chin. Cochin. in locis petrosis. Sin: *ae cham pu* (石菖蒲). Lour. 259.

Kth. enum. III. 87. Lour.'s plant is *Acorus terrestris*. Rumph. India orient. But the true *A. Calamus* is also found in South-China. Fl. hbk. 345.

609. *Orontium cochininchinense*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: *wei chom pu* (水薑蒲). Lour. 258.

Kth. enum. III. 87. *Acorus cochininchinensis*. Schott.

610. *Fothos scandens*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 650. Fl. hbk. 344.

611. *Arum esculentum*. Linn. China, Cochin. frequentissime. Cibus est communissimus. Sin: *hai yu* (海芋). Lour. 654.

Obs. 254.—Kth. enum. III. 87. *Colocasia esculenta*. Schott. *Calladium esculentum* Vent.

612. *Arum Colocasia*. Linn. Cochin. cult. Lour. 653.

Kth. enum. III. 87. *Colocasia antiquorum*. Schott.—According to Parker *yei foo* in Canton.

613. *Arum indicum*. Lour. Cochin. cult. 655.

Fl. hbk. 343.—Kth. enum. III. 89. *Colocasia indica*—A. indicum Lour. (vide Roxb.).

614. *Arum macrorhizum*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *dea vu*. Lour. 654.

Kth. III. 88. Linn.'s plant (India) is *Colocasia macrorhiza*. Schott.

615. *Arum cucullatum*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *chim mi vu*. 656.

Kth. III. 88. *Colocasia cucullata*. Schott.—Roxb. Fl. ind. III. 501. China australis, Bengal.

616. *Arum sagittifolium*. Linn. China, Cochin. culte, spont. Sin: *tai lei thau*. Lour. 653.

Kth. III. 44. Linn.'s plant *Xanthosoma sagittifolium*. Schott: America.

617. *Arum pentaphyllum*. Linn. China. Sin: *tien nan sie* (天南星). Lour. 652.
Kth. enum. III. 80. Linn.'s plant Arisema pentaphyllum. Schott. India orient. Lour.'s plant dubious.

618. *Arum triphyllum*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: puon hia (芋 葉). Lour. 652.

Kth. enum. III. 80. Arisema Louretri. Blume. Stirps dubia.

619. *Arum Dracontium*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: puon hia (芋 葉). Lour. 651.

Kth. III. 19. Lour.'s plant Arisema cochinense. Blume.

620. *Zala asiatica*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: jao peng (芋 葉). 492.

Endl. Gen. Pl. 1669. Pistia. In Peking the above Chin. name refers to Lemna minor. L.

621. *Typha latifolia*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: pu hoan (蓮 葉). Lour. 675.

Kth. enum. III. 90. Europe, Asia bor., America bor.—Frequent in North-China.

622. *Lemna minor*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 671.

Osb. 255.—Add. Fl. hbk. 129. Frequent in S. China.—Common also in N. China.

623. *Sagittaria sagittifolia*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 698.

Osb. 256.—Kth. enum. III. 157. Lour.'s plant is Sagittaria chinensis. Sims.

624. *Eriocaulon quadrangulara*. Lour. China, Cochin. Sin: koue san tsoo (穀 精 葉). 76.

According to Parker the above Chinese name in Canton is applied to Eriocaulon Wallichianum. Mart.

625. *Cyperus rotundus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: kiam phu cu (香 葱 子). Lour. 58.

Osb. 262.—Fl. hbk. 387.

626. *Cyperus elatus*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 54.

Kth. enum. II. 93. Linn.'s plant is Cyperus distans. Linn. India orient., Nova Holland. Maurit. C. B. Sp.—Fl. hbk. 387.

627. *Cyperus compressus*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 54.

Fl. hbk. 385. Common in S. China.

628. *Scirpus supinus*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 55.

Fl. hbk. 394. Isolpis supina. R. Br.

629. *Scirpus miliaceus*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 55.

Fl. hbk. 393. Flabristylis milacea. Vahl.

630. *Holcus Sorghum*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Lour. 793.

Sorghum vulgare. Pers. Cultivated throughout China.

631. *Holcus saccharatus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 792.

Sorghum saccharatum. Pers. Cultivated throughout China.

632. *Andropogon Schoenanthus*. Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: mao hiam (茅 香). Lour. 793.

Osb. 263.—Kth. enum. I. 488. India orient.
638. *Raphis trivialis*. Lour. China, Cochin. 676.
Kth. enum. I. 506. *Chrysopelea aculeata*. Trin.—Fl. hbk. 424.

634. *Saccharum spicatum* Linn. Cochin. Sin: *mao kei* (茅根). Lour. 67.
Kth. enum. I. #70. *Perotis latifolia*. Alt.—Fl. hbk. 418.

635. *Saccharum officinarum*. Linn. China, Cochin.
cult. Sin: *can che* (甘蔗). Lour. 66.
Obs. 265.—The Sugar cane is much cultivated in S. China.

636. *Triticum*. Variae species nascuntur in China. Sin: *me* (麥 *Triticum sativum*). Lour. 75.
Wheat is cultivated throughout China, more commonly in the northern provinces.

637. *Hordeum*. Sin: *men* (麥). Lour. 75.
*Men* is rather the classical Chinese name for Barley, which is cultivated in all provinces of the Empire, but more commonly in the north.

638. *Arundo Bambus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *ye cho* (薑竹). Lour. 70.
Obs. 292.—Monro. Bambusaceae. Trans. Linn. Soc. XXVI. *Bambusa arundinacea*. Retz. India, China. Hongkong cult. Hauck. (dubia.)

639. *Arundo agrestis* Lour. China, Cochin. 72.
Kth. enum. I. 482. *Bambusa agrestis*. Poir.

640. *Poa chinensis*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 69.
Obs. 287.—Fl. hbk. *Leptochloa chinensis*. Nees.—Kth. enum. I. 270. *L. tenerima*.

641. *Cynosurus aegyptius*. Linn. Lour. 75.
Obs. 291.—Dasylistenium aegyptiacum. Willd. Fl. hbk. 429.—*Elymus cruciatus*. Lam.

642. *Cynosurus indicus*. Linn. Lour. 75.
Fl. hbk. 429. *Elymus indica*. Gaert.

643. *Nardus indica*. Linn. In montibus occident. imper. Sinensis. Sin: *cam sum hiam* (甘松香). Lour. 56.
Kth. enum. I. 258. *Miscanthus setaceus*. R. Br.—Flor hbk. 428.

644. *Agrostis plicata*. Lour. Canton. Sin: *sam souc tsao*. 64.

645. *Agrostis indica*. Linn.? Cochinchina. Lour. 63.
Obs. 269.—Kth. enum. I. 211. *Sporebatus indica*. R. Br. Fl. hbk. 426.

646. *Spinifex squarrosus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 794.
Fl. hbk. 415.

647. *Panicum Crus Corvi*. Linn. Cochin. Lour. 59.
Kth. enum. I. 143. *Panicum Crus Galii*. L. Obs. 275. Fl. hbk. 411.—Common in N. China.

648. *Panicum miliaceum*. Linn. Pekini et aliis locis Sinarum. Colitur. Lour. 59.
Largely cultivated throughout China.
649. *Panicum italicum*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *siao me* (小米) *no* (粟). Lour. 58.
*Seteria italica*. Kth. Largely cultivated in China.

650. *Alopecurus hordeiformis*, Linn. Cochin. Lour. 60.
Obs. 280.—*Gymnothrix hordeiformis*, Nees. Observed also in N. China.

651. *Coix Lachryma*, Linn. Cult. China, Cochin. Sin: *y y gin* (薏苡仁). Lour. 673.
Kth. enum l. 20. India orient.—Cultivated throughout China.

652. *Coix agrestis*. Lour. 674.

653. *Zea Mays*, Linn. China, Cochin. cult. Sin: *pao tuo* (pao cut 包穀). Lour. 672.
Cultivated throughout China.

654. *Oryza sativa*, Linn. Sin: *mi* (米), *ho* (禾). Lour. 266.
Obs. 281.

655. *Oryza glutinosa*, Rumph. Sin: *no* (糯). Lour. 267.

CRYPTOGAMS.

656. *Equisetum arvense*, Linn. China. Sin: *ma hoam* (馬黃). Lour. 823.
Has been observed in North-China.

657. *Equisetum hiemale*, Linn. China. Sin: *mo ce* (木賊). Lour. 824.

658. *Lycopodium cernuum*, Linn. Cochin. Lour. 838.
Obs. 296.—Fl. hbk. 436.

659. *Ophioglossum lusitanicum*, Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *ze wi* (石韋). Lour. 825.
The above Chin. name is rather applied to *Niphobolus Lingue* Spr.

660. *Ophioglossum scandens*, Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: *zi wi tan* (石韋藤). Lour. 825.
Obs. 299.—Fl. hbk. 441. *Lygodium scandens*, Sw.

661. *Adiantum fiabellatum*, Linn. Canton. Sin: *tiet quai tsao* (鐵線草). Lour. 836.
Obs. 307.—Fl. hbk. 447.

662. *Adiantum candatum*, Linn. Cochin. Lour. 835.
Fl. hbk. 447.

663. *Pteris vittata*, Linn. China, Cochin. Lour. 834.
Obs. 304.

664. *Polypodium repandum*, Lour. China. Sin: *ku tsui pu* (骨碎補). 826.

665. *Polypodium simile*, Linn. China. Sin: *ku tsui pu* (See the preceding). Lour. 828.
666. *Polypodium varium*. Linn. China, Cochin. Esculentum. Lour. 829.

Osb. 300.—Add. Fl. hbk. 140. *Aspidium varium*. Sw.

667. *Polypodium Barometz*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: keu tsie (狗脊). Lour. 829.

Osb. 301.—Fl. hbk. 460. Add. Fl. hbk. 148. *Cibotium glaucum*. Benth. *Cibotium Barometz* J. Sm.

668. *Bryum undulatum*, Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: sien Lour. 840.

669. *Agaricus integer*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: kiun (菌). Lour. 848.

670. *Agaricus deliciousus*. Linn. China, Cochin. Sin: kiun tsuen (香蕈). Lour. 849.

VII. GROSIER. BUC'HOZ.

In 1785 Abbé Grosier published the first edition of his valuable *DESCRIPTION GÉNÉRALE DE LA CHINE* in one volume forming the 13th volume of Du Mailla's Histoire Générale de la Chine, edited also by the
learned Father Grosier, who was Bibliothécaire de Son Altesse Royale Monsieur, but had himself never visited China. A considerable part of his description of that Empire is devoted to Natural history, namely 106 pages to Botany. A new and much enlarged edition of the work he published from 1818 to 1820 in 7 volumes, nearly three of them treating of Natural history. Vol. II and III, 658 pages, deal with Botany. It supplies a mass of most valuable information with respect to Chinese plants, the vast material accumulated by the author having been principally derived from the accounts of the Jesuit missionaries found in the Lettres édifiantes, Du Halde, the Mémoires conc. les Chinois etc. But Grosier draws also from many unpublished sources. He endeavours to give a list of the Chinese plants which since then had been described by professed botanists. But besides Loureiro's plants from Southern China, of which he generally gives a full account, his enumeration of Chinese specimens known to botanists is far from being complete.

Although Grosier in reproducing all the observations of the missionaries concerning Chinese botany, seldom ventures to identify the plants described, his compilation is very useful and interesting, and I hope, that with the aid of the identifications and commentaries I have supplied in the preceding pages, almost all the statements of the Jesuits relating to Chinese plants will be understood by botanists.

We learn from Grosier that the Jesuit missionaries have introduced many Chinese plants into the Mauritius (Isle de France) and Bourbon, where they had also missions. Some of these plants were subsequently introduced from these islands into France. Thus *Briobotrya japonica* Lindl. had been brought from Canton to the Mauritius and from this place found its way to France, where in 1784 one specimen of the introduced shrubs blossomed. (Grosier II. 504.)—*Lieistonia chinensis* Mart. a Chinese palm was for a long time known in Europe under the name of *Latania bourbonica* Lam.—*Nephelium Litchi* was introduced at the end of the last cent. from China into the Mauritius and subsequently into Guyana. (Grosier II 478.)—In Lamarck's Enc. Bot. many Chinese plants are noticed as cultivated in the Mauritius. I may quote *Euphoria longona* (*Nephelium longonum*) Lam. III. 574, *Cockia punctata* l. c. VIII. 327, *Driandra cordata* (*Blacococca vernicia*). l. c. II. 329. *Anona uncinata*. (*Artabotrys odoratissimus*) l. c. II. 127, *Lilaeae chinensis* (*Tetrathera laurifolia*). l. c. III. 574. *Dianthus chinensis*. L. cultivated in Europe since the begin-
ning of the last century has probably also been introduced by the missionaries. Tournefort, who first described this plant in the Memoirs of the Acad. of Paris, 1705, p. 264, under the name of Caryophyllus chinensis, states that Abbé Bignon had received (seeds of) it from China about 3 years earlier.

It is merely for the sake of completeness in illustrating the botanical literature with respect to China, that I mention here two volumes of colored drawings of Chinese plants published by Buc'hoz, physician in ordinary to King Stanislas.

1. Collection précieuse et culminée des Fleurs qui se cultivent dans les jardins de la Chine. Paris 1776, in folio, 100 plates.

2. Herbier ou Collection des Plantes médicinales de la Chine, d'après un manuscrit peint et unique qui se trouve dans la bibliothèque de l'Empereur de la Chine. 100 plates.

These drawings with the Chinese names of the respective plants added (not in Chinese characters.) have been copied from some Chinese collection of pictures sent by the missionaries and have no claim to any botanical value. The medicinal plants especially are very badly represented. The other volume with ornamental plants shows more correct drawings.

Buc'hoz was a very prolific botanical author. But his publications are not entitled to serious attention. Pritzel in his Thesaurus botanicus, after having enumerated B.'s works states:

Catalogus noster partem solummodo parvam innumerabilium operum miserrimi compilatoris continet, in cujus ignominiam l'Hératier Buchozian foetidum condidit et qui per semiseculum (1758—1807.) ultra 500 volumina consarcinavit.

The plant Pritzel alludes to is Serissa foetida. Comm. Buchozia coprosmoides. l'Hér. See above Loureiro's plants 278.

We have thus in the preceding pages endeavoured to give a general review of the early knowledge acquired by European naturalists into the flora of China, and have also successively enumerated all Chinese plants which have come under the notice of European botanists up to about the end of the last century. Although the materials for pursuing this line of investigation and for bringing the historical account up to the present day have been accumulated by the author, he must now take leave of the reader, not being in the position at present to work up a treatise which would probably occupy twice as many pages as the present essay.
